query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Poscia che l’accoglienze oneste e liete 2 furo iterate tre e quattro volte, 3 Sordel si trasse, e disse: «Voi, chi siete?».
query.result:
**English:**
1 After the courteous and joyful greetings 2 had been repeated three and four times, 3 Sordello stepped forward and said: "You, who are you?".
**Malay:**
1 Setelah ucapan selamat datang yang sopan dan gembira 2 diulangi tiga dan empat kali, 3 Sordello melangkah maju dan berkata: "Kamu, siapa kamu?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
4 «Anzi che a questo monte fosser volte 5 l’anime degne di salire a Dio, 6 fur l’ossa mie per Ottavian sepolte.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Rather than to this mountain were turned 5 the souls worthy of ascending to God, 6 my bones were buried by Octavian.
**Malay:**
4 Daripada ke gunung ini diarahkan 5 jiwa-jiwa yang layak untuk naik kepada Tuhan, 6 tulang-belulangku dikuburkan oleh Octavian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 Io son Virgilio; e per null’ altro rio 8 lo ciel perdei che per non aver fé». 9 Così rispuose allora il duca mio.
query.result:
**English:**
7 I am Virgil; and for no other sin 8 did I lose heaven than for not having faith." 9 Thus replied then my leader.
**Malay:**
7 Akulah Virgil; dan bukan karena dosa lain 8 aku kehilangan surga selain karena tidak memiliki iman." 9 Demikianlah jawab pemimpinku saat itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Qual è colui che cosa innanzi sé 11 sùbita vede ond’ e’ si maraviglia, 12 che crede e non, dicendo «Ella è . . . non è . . . »,
13 tal parve quelli; e poi chinò le ciglia, 14 e umilmente ritornò ver’ lui, 15 e abbracciòl là ’ve ’l minor s’appiglia.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Like someone who sees something ahead of him 11 suddenly, at which he marvels, 12 who believes and does not, saying, “It is . . . it is not . . . ”,
13 such he appeared; and then he lowered his brows, 14 and humbly returned toward him, 15 and embraced him where the lesser one clings.
**Malay:**
10 Seperti orang yang melihat sesuatu di hadapannya 11 tiba-tiba, yang membuatnya heran, 12 yang percaya dan tidak, berkata, “Itu adalah . . . itu bukan . . . ”,
13 begitulah dia tampak; lalu dia menundukkan alisnya, 14 dan dengan rendah hati kembali kepadanya, 15 dan memeluknya di tempat yang lebih rendah menempel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 «O gloria di Latin», disse, «per cui 17 mostrò ciò che potea la lingua nostra, 18 o pregio etterno del loco ond’ io fui,
19 qual merito o qual grazia mi ti mostra? 20 S’io son d’udir le tue parole degno, 21 dimmi se vien d’inferno, e di qual chiostra».
query.result:
**English:**
16 "O glory of the Latin tongue," he said, "through whom 17 you showed what our language could do, 18 O eternal praise of the place from which I came,
19 what merit or what grace shows you to me? 20 If I am worthy to hear your words, 21 tell me if you come from hell, and from what circle."
**Malay:**
16 "Wahai kemuliaan bahasa Latin," katanya, "yang melaluinya 17 kamu menunjukkan apa yang dapat dilakukan oleh bahasa kita, 18 Wahai pujian abadi dari tempat asal-usulku,
19 jasa atau rahmat apakah yang menunjukkanmu kepadaku? 20 Jika aku layak untuk mendengar kata-katamu, 21 katakan padaku apakah kamu datang dari neraka, dan dari lingkaran yang mana."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 «Per tutt’ i cerchi del dolente regno», 23 rispuose lui, «son io di qua venuto; 24 virtù del ciel mi mosse, e con lei vegno.
query.result:
**English:**
22 "Through all the circles of the sorrowful kingdom," 23 he replied, "I have come here; 24 the power of heaven moved me, and with it I come.
**Malay:**
22 "Melalui semua lingkaran kerajaan yang menyedihkan," 23 jawabnya, "aku telah datang ke sini; 24 kuasa surga menggerakkanku, dan bersamanya aku datang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Non per far, ma per non fare ho perduto 26 a veder l’alto Sol che tu disiri 27 e che fu tardi per me conosciuto.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Not for doing, but for not doing have I lost 26 the sight of the high Sun which you desire 27 and which was recognized by me too late.
**Malay:**
25 Bukan karena berbuat, tetapi karena tidak berbuat telah kuhilangkan 26 pandangan pada Matahari yang tinggi yang kauinginkan 27 dan yang terlambat kuketahui.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Luogo è là giù non tristo di martìri, 29 ma di tenebre solo, ove i lamenti 30 non suonan come guai, ma son sospiri.
query.result:
**English:**
28 There is a place down there, not sad with martyrs, 29 but only dark, where the lamentations 30 do not sound like wails, but are sighs.
**Malay:**
28 Di sana ada tempat, tidak sedih dengan para martir, 29 tetapi hanya gelap, di mana ratapan 30 tidak terdengar seperti ratapan, tetapi desahan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Ma se tu sai e puoi, alcuno indizio 38 dà noi per che venir possiam più tosto 39 là dove purgatorio ha dritto inizio».
query.result:
**English:**
37 But if you know and are able, give us some indication 38 by which we can reach more quickly 39 the place where Purgatory rightly begins.
**Malay:**
37 Tetapi jika kamu tahu dan mampu, berikan kami petunjuk 38 agar kami dapat tiba lebih cepat 39 di tempat dimulainya Api Penyucian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Ma vedi già come dichina il giorno, 44 e andar sù di notte non si puote; 45 però è buon pensar di bel soggiorno.
query.result:
**English:**
43 But see how the day declines, 44 and it is not possible to go up at night; 45 therefore it is good to think of a pleasant resting place.
**Malay:**
43 Tetapi lihatlah bagaimana hari mulai gelap, 44 dan berjalan pada malam hari tidak mungkin; 45 oleh karena itu, adalah baik untuk memikirkan tempat peristirahatan yang menyenangkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Anime sono a destra qua remote; 47 se mi consenti, io ti merrò ad esse, 48 e non sanza diletto ti fier note».
query.result:
**English:**
46 Souls are here on the right hand, far removed; 47 if you consent, I will lead you to them, 48 and they will not be unpleasant to you to know.
**Malay:**
46 Jiwa-jiwa berada di sebelah kanan di sini, jauh terpencil; 47 jika kamu setuju, aku akan membawamu kepada mereka, 48 dan mereka tidak akan membuatmu tidak senang untuk mengenal mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 «Com’ è ciò?», fu risposto. «Chi volesse 50 salir di notte, fora elli impedito 51 d’altrui, o non sarria ché non potesse?».
query.result:
**English:**
49 "How is that?", was the reply. "Who would want 50 to climb at night, would be prevented 51 by others, or would not be able to do so?".
**Malay:**
49 "Bagaimana itu?", adalah balasannya. "Siapa yang ingin 50 memanjat di malam hari, akan dicegah 51 oleh orang lain, atau tidak akan mampu melakukannya?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 E ’l buon Sordello in terra fregò ’l dito, 53 dicendo: «Vedi? sola questa riga 54 non varcheresti dopo ’l sol partito:
55 non però ch’altra cosa desse briga, 56 che la notturna tenebra, ad ir suso; 57 quella col nonpoder la voglia intriga.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And the good Sordello traced his finger on the ground, 53 saying: "See? You would not cross this line alone 54 after the sun has set,
55 not because anything else would hinder you, 56 except the darkness of the night, from going up; 57 that, with its powerlessness, entangles the will.
**Malay:**
52 Dan Sordello yang baik menggoreskan jarinya di tanah, 53 berkata: "Lihat? Garis ini saja 54 tidak akan kau seberangi setelah matahari terbenam:
55 bukan karena hal lain yang menghalangi, 56 kecuali kegelapan malam, untuk naik ke atas; 57 kegelapan itu, dengan ketidakberdayaannya, menjerat keinginan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Ben si poria con lei tornare in giuso 59 e passeggiar la costa intorno errando, 60 mentre che l’orizzonte il dì tien chiuso».
query.result:
**English:**
58 I would be well content to return down there with her 59 and wander, straying along the shore, 60 while the horizon holds the day enclosed.
**Malay:**
58 Aku akan sangat senang untuk kembali ke bawah sana bersamanya 59 dan berjalan-jalan di sepanjang pantai sambil mengembara, 60 sementara cakrawala menahan hari yang tertutup.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Allora il mio segnor, quasi ammirando, 62 «Menane», disse, «dunque là ’ve dici 63 ch’aver si può diletto dimorando».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then my lord, almost in wonder, 62 said, "Lead me, then, where you say 63 one can find delight in dwelling."
**Malay:**
61 Kemudian tuanku, hampir dengan heran, 62 berkata, "Pimpinlah aku, kalau begitu, ke tempat yang kaukatakan 63 orang dapat menemukan kesenangan untuk tinggal."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Poco allungati c’eravam di lici, 65 quand’ io m’accorsi che ’l monte era scemo, 66 a guisa che i vallon li sceman quici.
query.result:
**English:**
64 We had proceeded but a short distance along the edge, 65 when I noticed that the mountain was cut off, 66 just as the valleys cut them off here.
**Malay:**
64 Kami telah berjalan sebentar di sepanjang tepi, 65 ketika aku menyadari bahwa gunung itu terputus, 66 seperti lembah-lembah yang memotongnya di sini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 «Colà», disse quell’ ombra, «n’anderemo 68 dove la costa face di sé grembo; 69 e là il novo giorno attenderemo».
query.result:
**English:**
67 "Over there," said that shade, "we will go 68 where the coast makes a lap of itself; 69 and there we will await the new day."
**Malay:**
67 "Ke sana," kata bayangan itu, "kita akan pergi 68 di mana pantai membuat pangkuan untuk dirinya sendiri; 69 dan di sana kita akan menunggu hari yang baru."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Tra erto e piano era un sentiero schembo, 71 che ne condusse in fianco de la lacca, 72 là dove più ch’a mezzo muore il lembo.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Between the steep and the plain there was a winding path, 71 which led us to the side of the hollow, 72 where the hillside dies away more than halfway down.
**Malay:**
70 Di antara yang curam dan yang datar ada jalan setapak yang berliku-liku, 71 yang membawa kami ke sisi jurang, 72 di mana lereng bukit mati lebih dari setengah jalan ke bawah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Oro e argento fine, cocco e biacca, 74 indaco, legno lucido e sereno, 75 fresco smeraldo in l’ora che si fiacca,
76 da l’erba e da li fior, dentr’ a quel seno 77 posti, ciascun saria di color vinto, 78 come dal suo maggiore è vinto il meno.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Gold and fine silver, cochineal and white lead, 74 indigo, polished and serene wood, 75 fresh emerald in the hour that it fades,
76 placed by the grass and the flowers, within that bosom, 77 each one would have been defeated in color, 78 as the lesser is defeated by its greater.
**Malay:**
73 Emas dan perak halus, cochineal dan timah putih, 74 nila, kayu yang dipoles dan tenang, 75 zamrud segar di saat ia memudar,
76 ditempatkan oleh rumput dan bunga-bunga, di dalam dada itu, 77 masing-masing akan dikalahkan dalam warna, 78 sebagaimana yang lebih rendah dikalahkan oleh yang lebih tinggi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Non avea pur natura ivi dipinto, 80 ma di soavità di mille odori 81 vi facea uno incognito e indistinto.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Nature alone had not painted there, 80 but with the sweetness of a thousand scents 81 it made there an unknown and indistinct [sensation].
**Malay:**
79 Alam semesta saja tidak melukis di sana, 80 tetapi dengan kelembutan seribu bau 81 ia membuat di sana suatu [sensasi] yang tidak diketahui dan tidak jelas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 ‘Salve, Regina’ in sul verde e ’n su’ fiori 83 quindi seder cantando anime vidi, 84 che per la valle non parean di fuori.
query.result:
**English:**
82 ‘Hail, Queen’ on the green grass and on the flowers 83 then I saw souls sitting and singing, 84 who did not seem to be outside for the valley.
**Malay:**
82 ‘Salam, Ratu’ di atas rumput hijau dan bunga-bunga 83 kemudian kulihat jiwa-jiwa duduk dan bernyanyi, 84 yang tampaknya tidak berada di luar lembah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 «Prima che ’l poco sole omai s’annidi», 86 cominciò ’l Mantoan che ci avea vòlti, 87 «tra color non vogliate ch’io vi guidi.
query.result:
**English:**
85 "Before the little sun sets," 86 began the Mantuan who had turned us, 87 "do not ask me to guide you among those."
**Malay:**
85 "Sebelum matahari kecil itu terbenam," 86 mulailah si Mantua yang telah membelokkan kami, 87 "jangan minta aku untuk membimbing kalian di antara mereka."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Di questo balzo meglio li atti e ’ volti 89 conoscerete voi di tutti quanti, 90 che ne la lama giù tra essi accolti.
query.result:
**English:**
88 On this cliff you will better recognize 89 the acts and faces of all of them, 90 than down in the pit where they are gathered.
**Malay:**
88 Di tebing ini kalian akan lebih mengenali 89 perbuatan dan wajah mereka semua, 90 daripada di lubang di bawah tempat mereka berkumpul.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Colui che più siede alto e fa sembianti 92 d’aver negletto ciò che far dovea, 93 e che non move bocca a li altrui canti,
94 Rodolfo imperador fu, che potea 95 sanar le piaghe c’hanno Italia morta, 96 sì che tardi per altri si ricrea.
query.result:
**English:**
91 He who sits highest and pretends 92 to have neglected what he should have done, 93 and who does not move his mouth to others' songs,
94 was Emperor Rudolf, who could have 95 healed the wounds that have killed Italy, 96 so that it would be too late for others to revive it.
**Malay:**
91 Dia yang duduk paling tinggi dan berpura-pura 92 telah mengabaikan apa yang seharusnya dia lakukan, 93 dan yang tidak menggerakkan mulutnya untuk nyanyian orang lain,
94 adalah Kaisar Rudolf, yang bisa saja 95 menyembuhkan luka-luka yang telah membunuh Italia, 96 sehingga akan terlambat bagi orang lain untuk menghidupkannya kembali.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 L’altro che ne la vista lui conforta, 98 resse la terra dove l’acqua nasce 99 che Molta in Albia, e Albia in mar ne porta:
100 Ottacchero ebbe nome, e ne le fasce 101 fu meglio assai che Vincislao suo figlio 102 barbuto, cui lussuria e ozio pasce.
query.result:
**English:**
97 The other, who comforted him with his sight, 98 ruled the land where the water is born 99 that the Arno carries in great quantity to the sea:
100 His name was Ottokar, and in his swaddling clothes 101 he was much better than his son Wenceslas, 102 the bearded one, whom luxury and idleness feed.
**Malay:**
97 Yang lainnya, yang menghiburnya dengan pandangannya, 98 memerintah tanah tempat air itu lahir 99 yang Arno bawa dalam jumlah besar ke laut:
100 Namanya Ottokar, dan dalam popoknya 101 dia jauh lebih baik daripada putranya Wenceslas, 102 yang berjanggut, yang diberi makan oleh kemewahan dan kemalasan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 E quel nasetto che stretto a consiglio 104 par con colui c’ha sì benigno aspetto, 105 morì fuggendo e disfiorando il giglio:
106 guardate là come si batte il petto! 107 L’altro vedete c’ha fatto a la guancia 108 de la sua palma, sospirando, letto.
query.result:
**English:**
103 And that little nose that, taking counsel, 104 seems to be with him who has such a kind appearance, 105 died fleeing and disfiguring the lily:
106 look there how he beats his chest! 107 You see the other who has made of his palm, sighing, a bed for his cheek.
**Malay:**
103 Dan hidung kecil itu yang mengambil nasihat, 104 tampak bersama dengan dia yang memiliki penampilan yang begitu baik, 105 mati melarikan diri dan merusak bunga bakung:
106 lihatlah di sana bagaimana dia memukul dadanya! 107 Anda melihat yang lain yang telah membuat telapak tangannya, sambil mendesah, menjadi tempat tidur untuk pipinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Padre e suocero son del mal di Francia: 110 sanno la vita sua viziata e lorda, 111 e quindi viene il duol che sì li lancia.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Father and father-in-law are of the evil of France: 110 they know their life is flawed and filthy, 111 and hence comes the grief that so torments them.
**Malay:**
109 Ayah dan mertua adalah dari kejahatan Prancis: 110 mereka tahu kehidupan mereka cacat dan kotor, 111 dan karenanya datanglah duka yang begitu menyiksa mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Rade volte risurge per li rami 122 l’umana probitate; e questo vole 123 quei che la dà, perché da lui si chiami.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Human goodness resurges through the branches 122 very rarely; and this is what he wants 123 who gives it, so that it may be called his.
**Malay:**
121 Kebaikan manusia bangkit kembali melalui dahan-dahan 122 sangat jarang; dan inilah yang diinginkan oleh dia 123 yang memberikannya, supaya kebaikan itu disebut miliknya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Anche al nasuto vanno mie parole 125 non men ch’a l’altro, Pier, che con lui canta, 126 onde Puglia e Proenza già si dole.
query.result:
**English:**
124 My words also go to the nose 125 no less than to the other, Pier, who sings with him, 126 because of whom Apulia and Provence already grieve.
**Malay:**
124 Kata-kataku juga sampai ke hidung 125 tidak kurang dari yang lain, Pier, yang bernyanyi dengannya, 126 yang karenanya Apulia dan Provence sudah berduka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Tant’ è del seme suo minor la pianta, 128 quanto, più che Beatrice e Margherita, 129 Costanza di marito ancor si vanta.
query.result:
**English:**
127 So much is the plant less than its seed, 128 as, more than Beatrice and Margaret, 129 Constance still boasts of her husband.
**Malay:**
127 Begitulah tanaman itu lebih kecil daripada bijinya, 128 sebagaimana, lebih dari Beatrice dan Margaret, 129 Constance masih membanggakan suaminya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Vedete il re de la semplice vita 131 seder là solo, Arrigo d’Inghilterra: 132 questi ha ne’ rami suoi migliore uscita.
query.result:
**English:**
130 See the king of the simple life, 131 sitting alone, Henry of England: 132 he has a better outcome in his branches.
**Malay:**
130 Lihatlah raja kehidupan yang sederhana, 131 duduk sendirian, Henry dari Inggris: 132 ia memiliki hasil yang lebih baik di cabang-cabangnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Quel che più basso tra costor s’atterra, 134 guardando in suso, è Guiglielmo marchese, 135 per cui e Alessandria e la sua guerra
136 fa pianger Monferrato e Canavese».
query.result:
**English:**
133 He who lies lowest of them all, 134 looking up, is Marquis Guglielmo, 135 because of whom Alessandria and its war
136 make Monferrato and Canavese weep.
**Malay:**
133 Dia yang paling rendah di antara mereka semua, 134 melihat ke atas, adalah Marquis Guglielmo, 135 karena siapa Alessandria dan perangnya
136 membuat Monferrato dan Canavese menangis.
